nodes.bodyText: Is there some object inheriting from AbtractModel which does not do this? If yes, why does it need to be separate method and not part of the constructor?

So I had a long time thinking about this. Originally I didn't include it as I did not want to add a HasMetadata as an argument, but also it sort of made sense to me that since all other label set fields are defined outside of the constructor this one should be also...
Happy to move it in if you disagree with this approach

I can probably live with this if you think it is better. I there is a risk that one day someone will forget to add it to some new model. However, as for adding the HasMetadatato the constructor ... it seesm in most cases you call it anyway with something like this as parameters: kafkaAssembly.getMetadata().getNamespace(), kafkaAssembly.getMetadata().getName(). So maybe the constructor could have only HasMetadata and get the name, namespace and labels out of it on its own.

Another option would be to define an abstract getter in AbstractModel, forcing subclasses to override it. I actually think this is preferable, since there's no need for this property to be mutable AFAICT.
I find it a bit weird that out of the 12 places where this is defined the comment is only here ;-)
Embarassing - originally only has these for kafka and zookeeper then saw the value in applying to them all.
No worries.
If I read it corrctly, this seems to be called only from one place. Shouldn't we use the Labels.geenrateDefaultLabels() directly and remove this?
You're absolutely right I will change this, I thought changing the signature would be useful but it wasn't

I think we need to sanitize this for length
EDIT: I can see you do that in the with...() methods. That means it is done multiple times and here were are vulnerable to someone adding new label without sanitizing it. Maybe you have a reson to keep it in the with...() methods. But it might be good to leave here a comment or something.

I would maybe phrase it more as in instruction for the next developer:
// When adding new labels, make sure the names of any resources are truncated for sanitization purposes to be compatible with Kubernetes => Labels can be only short
So I guess this is where it runs into #2743 and it is not clear to me how to deal with it.

For the short term I think we should modify this filter to allow a few whitelisted labels to be applied
https://github.com/strimzi/strimzi-kafka-operator/pull/2730/files#diff-6de62e326f52e6cc92e7ffd7e722e8f4R142
I suggest we only allow the app.kubernetes.io/part-of label as this one is used to group resources together? Looking at the others it is unclear what value it would have to allow them to be modifiable.
That sounds reasonable - I have only app.kubernetes.io/part-of so far reported as an issue.
I think Javadoc to explain what discovery is in this context would be helpful.
I think Javadoc to explain what a Strimzi name is in this context would be helpful.
